text: Psalm 12
Human Faithlessness and God’s Faithfulness

For the \add music\add* director; on the Sheminith.\f + \fr Ps 12 \ft Meaning uncertain \f* A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 12 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
Save, O Yahweh, for \add the\add* pious have ceased \add to be\add*;
for \add the\add* faithful have vanished
from \add among the\add* children of humankind.
They speak falseness ⸤to each other⸥.\f + \fr 12:2 \ft Literally “each with his companion” \f*
\add With\add* flattering lips,
\add with\add* ⸤a double heart⸥\f + \fr 12:2 \ft Literally “a heart and a heart” \f* they speak.
May Yahweh cut off all flattering lips,
\add the\add* tongue speaking great boasts—
\add those\add* who say, “With our tongue we will prevail.
Our lips \add are\add* on our side.
Who \add is\add* master over us?”
“Because of \add the\add* oppression of \add the\add* afflicted,
because of \add the\add* groaning of \add the\add* poor,
now I will rise up,” Yahweh says.
“I shall put \add them\add* in \add the\add* safety \add for which\add* they\f + \fr 12:5 \ft Hebrew “he” \f* long.”
The words of Yahweh \add are\add* pure words
\add like\add* silver refined in the crucible on the ground,
refined seven times.
You, O Yahweh, will protect them.
You will preserve him\f + \fr 12:7 \ft Or “us” \f*
from this generation always.
\add The\add* wicked prowl about
when vileness \add is\add* exalted among \add the\add* children of humankind.
